Section 15(g)(1) of the Small Business Act is amended to require the President to annually establish Government-wide goals for task orders and delivery orders placed against contracts awarded to small business concerns. Government-wide goals are set annually for task orders and delivery orders placed against contracts awarded to small business concerns, including those owned by service disabled veterans, HUBZone small business concerns, socially and economically disadvantaged individuals, and women. SEC. 5. IMPROVEMENTS TO THE SMALL BUSINESS RESERVE. Section 15(j) of the Small Business Act is amended to increase the threshold from $100,000 to $200,000 and to include applicability to task or delivery orders placed against multiple award contracts, including those under the Federal Supply Schedule program.
